I ordered two t-shirts on sale to be delivered to a UPS store access point. UPS decided to change delivery to a pizza parlor instead, twice failed to deliver the package, and then decided to return the package to GAP. Needless to say, this was a frustrating example of UPS incompetence.However, I called GAP customer service and spoke with Gracie on 10-22-20 who fixed everything perfectly. She immediately understood the problem and proceeded to repurchase and ship the shirts at an even better discount than I had before while processing the return for the bungled shipment. Honestly, this was probably the most competent and enjoyable customer service experience I've ever had with a business, especially when the issue wasn't even GAP's fault. Thank you so much, Gracie & GAP!

Review Title: I love this site and products but ...
Review Text: I love this site and products. Quality cotton products, prices and order service. Review Title: Gap is blowing it big time‚Ä¶

Review Title: Love Gap but can't order online as Yodel delivery drivers won't deliver
Review Text: Love Gap but can't order online. They use the delivery company Yodel who refuse to deliver to my flat door, they will only deliver to the main door of the building even when i let them into the block using the intercom. Unfortunately I am not always able to go down to collect the parcel due to having a baby so the delivery driver returns my parcel back to Gap stating that I refused it.Gap needs to look into their delivery company. In my order all the items were small regular size I called customer service and they said they did not send the shirt because they did not have it in stock and they asked me to return the jeans which I don‚Äôt have a problem with except that I need to take time and gas to do itWhy would they send you something that you did not order instead of letting you know that they don‚Äôt have it in stock  and even asked you to return it My refund will take 5 to 10 business days Of course I‚Äôm going to cancel gap credit card and won‚Äôt shop there again !!

Absolutely terrible. I bought a bra online in August, it wasn't comfortable so I returned it by mail in early September. They claim they haven't received it, have no record that I returned it, and are saying they can't return my money. They said, let's wait until the end of October to see if the bra is returned in the mail. Meanwhile, I have no bra and no money. The least Gap could do is recognize that we are in usual circumstances (and that the post office is in collapse right now), take customers' word about returns, and return our money. It is not acceptable to wait two months for my money back. Furthermore, each time I call Gap to try to solve the issue by phone, I am put on hold and the entire phone call sometimes lasts over half an hour. The people on the phone are friendly, but that doesn't solve any of the above issues.

Review Title: This is the worst customer service and‚Ä¶
Review Text: This is the worst customer service and clothing store I have ever had. Review Title: I bought a pair of shoes for‚Ä¶
Review Text: I bought a pair of shoes for granddaughter on April 2nd.  They have been backordered a couple of times,  and were supposed to ship around July 9th.  Like everyone else's reviews, calling customer service is a joke!  I've been calling for about 2 months now to cancel order.  They are summer shoes, and by she maybe gets them, it will be fall, and probably too small to wear!  I got a email from Gap today telling me new possible shipping date, and if I want to cancel, call customer service!!  I emailed back, but doubt I will hear back.  I called my bank and tried disputing charges, but have to wait until they ship.  For the rest of you reading this, and waiting for Gap to give you refuns, try calling your credit card number and disputing charges.  I did it recently on another purchase, and it was quick, and company finally reached out to me. Its ridiculous the size of Gap, and all the other stores they own, can't do better even through this covid.  They could be working from home.  The shoes finally arrived this week (july 29).  They were too small!  To be once and for all done with this experience, I took shoes back to Gap store, and got a refund, instead of shipping back.

Review Title: I received half of my order in a timely‚Ä¶

Review Title: Just Because You're Paranoid Doesn't Mean They Aren't After You.
Review Text: I always try to be fair and update or delete any bad reviews if things improve, which I did with Gap in July after a particularly harsh review. Well, not anymore. Not with Gap. Wish there was a minus star option... Suddenly they started cancelling all my orders automatically, each cancellation followed by an obscure email about "security reasons" and "potential fraud". The first time this happened was during their 50% off sale about 10 days ago,  so I missed out on the item I wanted - my size ran out. Not wanting to waste money on a long international phone call I emailed customer service. But that's useless - you immediately get a reply stating that GAP don't reply to emails. Catch 22, only not funny. Somehow I managed to get them to offer me price adjustment if the item gets back in stock. It did. Now all I had to do was follow instructions - replace the order and reply to the price adjustment email. I did. Another cancellation, and no response to my email because Gap do not respond to emails... Ordered a 3rd time using a different credit card. Order cancelled. Still no response. Oh how I miss you, Yossarian...

Review Title: I cannot believe that a company of this‚Ä¶

Review Title: Don't let the ONE STAR fool you...
Review Text: Damn....too bad this doesn't allow one to select ZERO stars.  If you're looking for something to lighten your day or make you laugh...go to their "Customer Service" page.............now while their "Customer Service" is A joke, it's not THE joke, the joke is when you land on their Customer Service page, right under their Customer Service banner is a section titled "Top Customer Questions", choose the "Can I change or cancel my order?" question... RIMSHOT!  There's your joke of the day!  The first three words..."Contact us immediately".  I understand there's a pandemic going on and that they are busier than normal, but waiting on a phone for over 180 minutes without reaching a live agent, no expected wait time or even an option to leave a voicemail is completely unacceptable!  Fix your "Customer Service" GAP/OLD NAVY.

Gap has the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever experienced. In fact, it‚Äôs so bad I can‚Äôt even get ahold of the customer service that‚Äôs how bad it is. I went to return them and another item I purchased and the online return center said I couldn‚Äôt return either of them neither my shipping emails nor the website says they are nonrefundable or final sale.

Review Title: I made a return on May 1st and May 5th‚Ä¶

Review Title: Lacks Premium Selection, Meh Basics, Should Just Focus Making Fashionable Workwear
Review Text: Seems like people have terrible experience. Let's see when my latest order arrives. Personally, I never had any shipping problems until now. I paid for 2 day shipping and it's been almost 2 weeks! Unacceptable! But I guess it's not their fault, it's the courier company's fault.I love their selvedge line (the 100% cotton ones), I just hope they offer more cuts, colors, and even heavier weights on their denim. The rest of their selection are meh, you can get much better and even cheaper basics on other brands. Personally, I think gap should just focus on making casual workwear inspired clothes. Maybe some 5 pocket/chino style duck canvas pants, field jackets, anything selvedge, there is a gap in that area bec no company as large as GAP (as far as I know) offers those. Actual workwear brands have cuts for actual work and it just looks bad wearing casually so I doubt Gap will compete with them for some time.I would love to have access to 100% cotton heavyweight duck canvas apparel, heavy selvedge denim and everything heavy without having to resort ordering from abroad or online on small stores.

Review Title: We have more than $200 in coupons that‚Ä¶
Review Text: We have more than $200 in coupons that Gap has promised we can use, despite the COVID pandemic, for online purchases. However, applying those coupons toward online purchases is proving next to impossible. So we tried an online chat with a Gap representative. No one appeared on the chat. Next, we tried phoning the Gap customer service line. It rang perhaps 12 times, and then an announcement came on saying that "no one" was available to answer our call. There are many companies during this pandemic -- Amazon, McDonald's, Starbucks, to name a few -- that have found creative ways to continue to serve their customers. Gap doesn't appear to be one of them.

Review Title: I have literally been on hold presently‚Ä¶

In addition, I am trying to cancel 1 item from a May 15th order because it won't ship until June 11th (supposedly, but who really knows?).  This is by far the absolute worse customer service imaginable.  You cannot reach anyone and there is no one available to help address problems that Gap has itself created.  I understand that there is Covid 19 pandemic but why can't they hire enough customer service phone reps. to answer phones from remote locations, home, etc.?  I will definitely not be placing any more orders with this company until the Covid-19 pandemic subsides because they are literally impossible to deal with. Review Title: Avoid buying at Gap. I have been conned by them. It could be you next.
Review Text: I can see that over 70% of the reviews are bad on Truspilot. This is not surprising as Gap have no respect for there loyal customers either. I have been buying Gap cloths for over 25 years now and recently bought three pairs of Pyjamas worth ¬£44. Unfortunately due to defective materials the garments  have shrunk despite following correct washing instructions. When I wrote an email to there CEO Mr. Peck firstly he does NOT believe in replying to customers directly, as he feels customers are not that important. This is a guy who is paid millions of dollars in salaries and bonus yet takes customers for granted. Eventually I got a reply from a disrespectful member of team who was only blowing Gaps trumpet in how good they are and asked me to take the clothes to a Gap store. Even though I had bought the garments online and supplied pictures which don‚Äôt lie I was basically told to get lost in the usual Gap language. I use to spend over ¬£1000 per annum but for sake of ¬£44 these amateurish organisations behaved in an abhorrent way despite supplying proof with pictures. I would never buy from these cowboys again. Beware as they DO NOT appreciate loyalty and should you experience any faults with your garments they will tell you to go for a ride. Avoid buying from them is the only way to hurt these cowboys in taking customers for a ride in this abhorrent way.

Review Text: Honestly I‚Äôve been waiting since about Christmas time to use my Gapcash which just came up eligible to use. The deal is spend $50 get $20 off. I get a better deal just waiting until you have a 40% off offer. Thanks for nothing!

Review Title: Will never shop at gap ever again
Review Text: Place one order they sent me the wrong size so I returned it. A month later I‚Äôm still waiting for a refund! I must have rung gap up to 8 tones over the period of a month to get this sorted. In the meantime I was given a discount an had to reorder again even though I‚Äôd had no refund for the first order. I thought it was a joke when my second order arrived again in the wrong size. So I sent it back and for some reason it was refunded in a week. I had to then reorder another colour just to get a hoody in the right size but eventually after much messing around fone calls to customer services an trips to the post office to return I was happy I‚Äôd finally got the hoody in the right size. I spent the next two weeks chasing the refund for my first order I told customer services I was not happy with all the messing about and I think they should compensate me, she said she would email me some vouchers but she never did. She said she was launching an inquiry in to the warehouse to locate my return an this may take a few days. After 2 days they email me saying they are refunding me but not at the price I paid but the discount price is been given on my second order!! For gods sake I‚Äôve never know such incompetence ever, first time I‚Äôve ordered on line an never again in fact never shopping at gap again. I call customers services to sort it all out again and went though having to explain the whole issue I‚Äôd been going through the advisor was rude and hung up on me so I had to call back again and again explain to another advisor called Debbie who within seconds clearly didn‚Äôt want to hear me moving about my longwinded story and refunded me for the first order at the price I paid. She couldn‚Äôt get me off the phone quick enough! Always speak to an American call centre and out of the 8 times I had to call all the advisors were trying to help me but two were rude patronising and the tone on their voice smarmy and sarcastic made me really annoyed. At last all of this hassle and I‚Äôve been told I will get my refund but how long that will take I don‚Äôt know. I wish I‚Äôd have seen all these reviews before attempting to buy a jumper on line. Awful experience and I will never shop in gap online or in store again. A company this big really needs to get their act together. Stay away at all costs! They will be left with no customers at this rate!

Review Text: You can't use a gift card online!!!?? And you can't order the size that you want of the product you want to store!! It's 2019! Due to it being a gift card, this will be the last time I ever shop at GAP.

Waiting for refund I‚Äôm so agree with the reviews , if I knew before I made order , I wouldn‚Äôt order anything from gap . This is the worst customer service . Haven‚Äôt received any email confirmation about received and refund info . Still waiting refund money back to my account . This is my first time order online from Gap , was the worst experience . The jeans have all worn out and split at the crotch after only 2 washes. GAP if you are reading this I am more than happy to show you your rubbish clothing, but you probably dont need to do that as your buying and QC teams are well aware of how shoddy your clothing has become. Disgraceful.

Review Title: Ordered a number of items online

Review Title: Worst ever shopping experience with GAP
Review Text: Worst shopping experience with GAP! It was my first time shopping in GAP and worst ever experience. I ordered on Nov 23th, 2018. When I connected with UPS for package, they were looking for UPS tracking number which is not provided to me by GAP. Its really frustrating to coordinate with GAP and UPS for delivery of shipment. I have been forced to cancel the order. Never recommend anyone to use GAP products because of worst service experience!

Review Title: Horrible Customer Service, and CC policies
Review Text: I wish I could give a lower score than 1 Star. Their customer service is the absolute WORST. My advice is DO NOT get a GAP credit card, unless you‚Äôre a fan of headaches. I completely regret getting the credit card, and I‚Äôm not going to even bother shopping there again to redeem my rewards after my waste of time today. No apologizes, no real sympathy, no offering how to make it easier in any way. Repeat: DO NOT GET A CREDIT CARD. And save yourself from the staff at U village GAP, and shop... anywhere else.

Review Title: I ordered a couple shirts for my Dad‚Ä¶
Review Text: I ordered a couple shirts for my Dad for Fathers day.  I used the expedited 1 day shipping.  I ordered them on a Thursday thinking that the order would be processed on Friday and delivered on Saturday, the day before Father's day.  Well not so.  Gap doesn't tell you an expected ship date until a couple days later and now I find out that the order won't make it in time for Father's Day.  I called them and told them it never said the delivery date would be so much later than 1 day, they said I should have found their delivery policy online.  I asked them to refund the expedited delivery and they said they would not do that.  So you are going to hide the expected delivery date from your customer, and then won't refund the cost of the expedited shipping once it was clear that there wasn't any notification during ordering.  This is bs.  Gap also didn't inform me that this purchase would be a Mail Only return until after I was sent the confirmation email for the order.  If I had known that you can't return the item in the store, I would have shopped somewhere else.  I am NEVER using gap online ever again.  Borderline criminal.

Honestly - most appalling customer service I had ever encountered anywhere! All is well with GAP until problems arise. I have recently encountered two issues which needed customer services help.1. My log in stopped working. The girl on the phone admitted she did not have a clue and that was where conversation ended. That is it. No, they cannot help me with that.2. Having lost the receipt, my return was not accepted. Although, online info says ""Without proof of purchase and order date, you can return items for a merchandise exchange or a merchandise certificate only based on the selling price on the date of return.‚Äù No. That is not possible. Just not possible. They don't do that sort of thing. That online information probably means something else.Emailing does not get you anywhere. They do not respond. Or you will probably get a reply with selective irrelevant answers.What a joke! Avoid. Go somewhere else. Plenty of shops around.

Review Title: I ordered a WINTER jacket for my 12 ‚Ä¶
Review Text: I ordered a WINTER jacket for my 12 year old son on December 1st it said it was supposed to take 6 to 12 days for delivery. 18 days later we still did not receive the jacket so I decided to call customer service. The woman on the phone explained to me that the jacket was never shipped from them it was supposed to be shipped from a store and the store must not have had the jacket in stock so they were unable to fulfill the order. So the store who had no jacket to ship left it at that our card was charged we did not receive product left it at that if I would not have called I wonder what would have happened. No emails no apologies and now almost 3 weeks later my son has no winter jacket mind you we live in Minnesota mind you that not a Gap store around us even sells winter jackets in the store there's a problem right there hello it is Minnesota why can we not carry jackets in the store why do I need to order them online. Anyways after I cancelled the order this morning to get my refund because apparently there was no jacket ever but nobody was ever going to tell me that. I was sent an email telling me that my item has been returned we returned our item and we will be refunded no we did not return anything we never received it and we were charged for it a lot of other places don't charge you until the item is shipped like there's a huge problem here that needs to be resolved and the only thing that was done about it it was covered up and hidden from maybe somebody who could fix the. By saying that we return the item looks like we didn't like it that never happened we never received an item. And now it's going to take up to 10 days for us to get our money back for something we never even had in my book that's stealing they stole our money if we did that to them they would have put us in jail thank you gap for all your wonderful years of wonderful beautiful comfortable clothing but my relationship with you has came to an end.

Review Title: North Korea probably has faster shipping and better service
Review Text: Awful. Ordered 27th of November and my order was only shipped on the 10th of December, after numerous times chatting their customer service. They were never helpful and kept just sending macros and pre-written 'apologies' about the delay. They promised me overnight shipping and even swore that it would be shipped from the UK to Ireland at 10pm on the 7th of December for arrival on the next morning. Obviously it didn't turn up. Following that I got an email saying they're backlogged and it could take 30 days (!?) to ship, maximum. I ordered two things. I've bought cheap tat from China without tracking that's arrived faster.So on the 10th, I get an email saying it's shipped. Phew. That's a relief. But no, no it isn't. The tracking still hasn't updated as of the 12th - so I chat them again. The girl straight up offers me a refund. I didn't even ask - which makes me think something was up. I did ask, 'So I'm not getting my order - given it was mean to be overnighted?' and she said it looks unlikely. So now I have a charge on my account waiting to be reversed for an order I placed 3 weeks ago - that was never sent. Just awful all around. I try to look for positive in everything, but this was void of anything remotely positive.

Review Title: Don‚Äôt seem to be able to meet delivery times....
Review Text: Ordered a casual men‚Äôs shirt on Tuesday this week and paid ¬£6 for 2-3 business day delivery, having the 30% off promo code was good and only reason this is 2* rather than 1*. Checked status today bearing in mind the item should be delivered tomorrow (Friday) and the item has still not been shipped, customer services apologised but gave no reason or admitted fault. I have cancelled the item and ordered the Same item today from ASOS which was ¬£12 cheaper and already on its way for delivery tomorrow, come on GAP you need to get your act together! Won‚Äôt be buying online from you again.

Review Title: I placed an order on November 29th and ‚Ä¶

Review Title: Why isn't there a negative star ‚Ä¶
Review Text: Why isn't there a negative star ratings? one star is too generousfor this outrageous customer service. okay, here is what happened.I placed an online order for three shirts(all are gifts on my travel) on November 22, 2017 03:15 AM (EST).And it was guaranteed to be delivered on the November 30, 2017 and paid $7.71 for shipping and handling.knowing that I will get it before my two month trip outside ofUSA on the Dec 8, 2017, I was satisfied placing my order. Here is where things become ugly ,when I did not receive the items on that dateI checked in to see the order status and was changed to be delivered on December 05 ,2017(Still okay with this:)). I started following on the status knowing that they might change it again and when I checked again on the  4th of December 2017,they again updated the delivery date to the 09th of December and now I called to customer service knowing that they might do something about it.The person(male forgot his name?) I talked to was nice and willing to help me with that. First he said sorry for that and took off the shipping and handling fee and guaranteed it will be delivered on the 06th of December. I followed up and saw the status is still on the 09th of December and I thought he might forgot to update me. I called again on the 05th of December to talk to another agent (her name may be Amanda? sorry for that)She said that I need to call to the carrier(Which I thought is none of my business) to hold the item in their facility until I return back( what?)I told her I need the item as a gift to the persons I'm traveling to. She keep on holding me a lot of times as if she's figuring out something(Which I don‚Äôt think much is going on while I was in hold...probably I was in hold for 20minutes) anyways, She comes backand told me she is taking off 30% of the price I was charged, Still told her I don‚Äôt need the price adjustments and needed to talk to the supervisor. She told me thatthe supervisor will do nothing at all and I told her I will at least try my chances to pass my concerns. After the usual long hold, I 'm able totalk to the supervisor(which do nothing as the agent suggested, at least the agent got this right:)) to my surprise to inform me that the order is cancelled and the amount will be credited(What?) Did I tell you  to cancel my order? the Supervisor is horrible and I don‚Äôt think she should be there. I told her why they are losing customers toAmazon and other big players and told her I will never be GAP's /Banana Republic's customer anymore(thank you for taking my money for more than a decade) and will write my experience onthe review to their site and any social networking sites I use. I had the same order with EXPRESS and they managed the way I wanted and never be dissatisfied with their customer services. I WILL BE SUPRISED IF GAP SERVIVED THE DYNAMICS OF THIS  millennials shopping habits.

I returned an online purchase which was received by Gap on the 24 November, ten days later I am still waiting for an acknowledgment of receipt of the items and a refund.  I have emailed customer services but had to resend the email three times before getting a response.  Looking at the visitor posts on their Facebook page I am not alone in this problem, many people are having the same experience so beware of ordering online from Gap!

Really really poor service, aspecilly in Westfield branch , I went with my friend on Thursday about 8 o clock, had to wait in queue about 40 minutes , at the end when I was trying to talk about the skinny lady on the till was so rude,such a bad customer,

In the 17 years I have shopped at gap I have shopped sensibly .Less then a forthright ago I went in to shop for my boys and I was told about a cash back over promo if I spent over ¬£30 i would get ¬£15 cash back but I spent over ¬£45 then I was told if you spend ¬£60 you would get ¬£30 cash back so I stretched myself even though I didn't have any money to shop at the time ,I egarly anticipated for the week to roll on to use my ¬£30 cash back which I was told I could even use on sale items but I would have to use it in two separate transactions as they didn't have a whole ¬£30 cash back voucher for me .I went back today to use my vouchers I picked out  my sons clothes excitedly as I'm bit strapped for cash lately and I just wanted to top him up for the summer as he loves well all three of them love gap wear .When I got to the till I was dealt by two mangers which were extremely unhelpful and not willing to except what I explained about there staff members misleading me to buy more and I could use it on my next visit but the never mentioned I had to spend again to use it even thou I was angry and frustrated by the way they coned me into spending more money I couldn't let my kid down as I promised him is out fit .That was hugely irresponsible of GAP to mislead its customers with this promotion I trusted the staff info and I was extremely upset when the manger kept pointing out at the voucher That I should have read what it said on the back of the card HOW RUDE !OMG JUST GOT  HOME TO FIND OUT I HAVE HAD MY ACCOUNT DEBITED TWICE AS MY CARD DID'NT GO THROUGH THE FIRST TRANSACTION .

Review Title: I have been shopping at Gap for 15 ‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have been shopping at Gap for 15 years and today was the worst service I got. The lady was chatting with her colleagues till one pointed I was waiting. She had a badge saying I ‚ù§Ô∏è to smile but you could see bacteria before that. She gave me a coupon saying it would ¬£15 off from my next shopping within a week. When I asked would it work even if I buy on sale items she said she doesn't know. I pressed the question again saying I might be back if that  is the case she replied we are not forcing you to come and started chatting with her colleagues again without even saying a goodbye.

Review Title: This is the first time I ordered GAP ‚Ä¶
Review Text: This is the first time I ordered GAP products online. After a few days I got a message saying my order has been cancelled, no explanation provided. However, my dress was still delivered (?). The customer services number online is 00 1 614-744-3907, i ditched the first 0 thinking it was a UK number. I got through to a non GAP company, who informed many people call this number by mistake. I searched for a UK number 020 7518 6100, only to get through to an automated message. I want to speak to a person - not a machine. I selected customer relations option when I re-dialled only to be disconnected after waiting on the phone for a while. Really?Never ordering online again. Useless company!! How dare you wasting your customers time.
Consistently excellent service. (Reading Centre) Staff are always very helpful and nothing is too much trouble.

Delivery was a nightmare. I placed an order and until I contacted customer service nothing seemed to have happened. There were 4 working days and even despatch notification was only sent after I complained twice. Customer service didn't have any knowledge what was happening with my order and just said "it SHOULD arrive this week" - but I'm guessing they did find something and did something as I received despatch notification on that day later on. Wish they are able to manage more from getting orders to despatch/delivery. Thought it used to be better before!

Ordered several times. Everything okay with sizes and delivering but one thing a little bit annoying is that they've freezed money in my account and then made payments another time by the same amount and just after delivery released the freezed ones
Size UK 10 massive on me, but the UK 8 won't fit. Sort your sizing out. You junction 1 shop in Antrim is always a mess and the staff really don't seem bothered in anyway to help. Not good enough.

Review Title: If I could give these people a zero
Review Text: If I could give these people a zero, I would. They are clearly incompetent in providing the most basic of customer service. I had been a repeated customer who spent a fair sum for a single person until running into even the most minor of issues which other companies handling online orders would have been able to solve with absolute ease. If they cannot handle online customers, they should not offer it, plain and simple.
Weird sizing. Delivery is delayed. No one should waiting that much for clothes.

DO NOT ORDER FROM GAP.I ordered a coat in a size 8 it was finally delivered after 2 weeks, the coat is sized as small but is really a size 12 - 14. The website states they do free returns by mail but when you go to return it and dig a bit deeper it turns out they dont have a free mail returns option, you have to drop it to a DHL location which is miles from me and in a retail park down the country, there is no option to return by mail. Customer support wont reply to my emails, facebook messages or answer the phone. Ive never ordered from gap before, ive always thought of them as a good, reliable company. I regularly order from Debenhams, Asos and other companies and have never had this issue before. Ill be taking this further if I dont get a response to my email.

Review Title: all the clothes they sent were faded ‚Ä¶
Review Text: all the clothes they sent were faded and had stains on them. like they were from the returns pile. never going to deal with the gap again.

Ordered goods online on Wednesday to be delivered to store , with the thought that this would be quick and convenient . Checked on Saturday  afternoon and the goods had still not arrived . Going on holiday Monday morning so will not receive goods in time, so when I arrive home I will be returning goods.Absolutely disgusting service from a large company.Why does it take so long?Nearly every other online retailer can deliver such much quicker DO NOT USE THE ONLINE SERVICE
Got a really cute outfit for my baby. Shipping took a little long but to be fair it was holiday season.
I personally had good experiences with them

I haven't shopped with GAP for over two years and this is the worst retail store I have visited. The women dress or shift design are a nightmare whoever designs your clothes should be fired on the spot. If you going to charge $89.99 for a dress please hire someone that knows about design these look like a night mare that was sewn in a foreign country. I will never enter your stores again please get your retail stuff together ugly ugly clothes very sad.

Review Title: The costumer service is the worst
Review Text: So I missed one payment Once. I was out of town for wedding and unfortunately there was no service at all, so I missed few of my usual payments and as I came back I paid some of them right the way but as I had some extra expenses on my brothers wedding I left the Gap bill to be paid on the next due date as I was already late and late payment fee was already applied so it makes more sense for me to just make my next payment on the next due date. But wait! they are calling me from 15 to 27 times a day literally starting at 7am and up until 11pm constant calling Even though I had spoken to a costumer service right after I came back and explained what happend and what is my plan they said It is absolutely understandable and that they will be expecting next payment when it is due. But the calling never stopped I had to block one of their numbers because it feels absolutely wrong to receive this many calls after you spoke to someone about it but now they call from Russia . This is just absurd I only missed one payment First time since I had this card. I am going to close this account when I pay it off and will never have another card with them again . What they do called Stalking and it makes people very uncomfortable . Shame on you guys you should know better

Sent return on 20th January 17 and track and trace confirmed delivery to Gap took place on 23rd January 17.Return not processed until 10th February 2017, 15 days from the date the received my returned item.Customer Service Advisor confirmed that all returns are put into a container and processed on a specified date by GAP.Additionally you then have to wait for the refund to be processed back into your account, making the whole process to the timescale of almost 4 weeks.As my return was over ¬£250.00 in value, in my opinion totally unacceptable.  I had funds in bank to allow me to cover this cost until return processed, however i believe there would be people who could not afford to have this amount of cost in the stores account instead of their own.

Review Title: Bad customer service and slow returns
Review Text: First off, I had no returns label in my package. I contacted customer service and was told to print my own from Collect+. I pressed on to ask for a Royal Mail label, after which they said they could send one but it would take a week. Really?Finally returned my item via Collect+. Two weeks later, no word. I checked the tracker on Collect+ and was told the package had been returned to GAP more than 10 days earlier. Contacted GAP again - was told there was a delay of up to TWO WEEKS in processing returns once they arrived at the warehouse 'because of the holidays'. I ordered my package on 15/1 and returned on 24/1, go figure. Told them I was unhappy about the service and would not be buying from GAP again. Then was given another excuse of an unforeseen fault in their processing system. Clearly rubbish. Customer service person apologised but never offered a real explanation and just told me to wait longer. Was never offered a discount or any other service. Best avoid.

Review Title: WIll never shop at gap.com again
Review Text: I had a terrible experience purchasing jeans online around the holidays.  Got numerous emails stating the order was delayed which would be followed by emails asking me how I liked my new jeans which had not yet arrived.  Finally after three weeks and many hours wasted on hold the agent suggested cancelling the order and buying them in the store which I did.  However, the now unwanted supposedly cancelled jeans showed up the next day!  Another call to online customer service and more time on hold, and as a courtesy I was told I could keep the jeans and they would credit me back the price.  Unfortunately we no longer needed the jeans because I had bought another set and they were the wrong size anyway. The agent on the phone at the time said just take them back to the store and exchange them for something else. But the store won't honor the exchange because it was a dispute with gap.com, and gap.com won't honor the exchange because they have terrible customer service.  It doesn't help me to have free jeans that don't fit, so the courtesy they extended to acknowledge the hassle they put me through is meaningless.  I will never use gap online again when the customer service at the store is so much better.
Amazing service

HORRIBLE AND HORRIBLEWe ordered twice from GAP.COM and twice we waited for around 20 days to get the item.   My recent order placed 9:27:29 PM ET on Dec 01, 2016.Today is Dec 16, 2016.  I just got the email from them stating that it is on its way.   I would never order from this place again.  Amazon and Macys should be a great example for this store shipping policies. I DO NOT KNOW HOW THEY SURVIVE.

I bought clothes from Gap online a year ago which never turned up. I thought maybe that was a one off experience so I ordered some clothes again online. They didn't turn up. When I talked to customer services about it they suggested that I cancel the order and then re-order and they would deliver it express for free. It also emerged that the delivery company stated in the e-mail relating to the first order was wrong and the tracking information was therefore wrong. So I waited for the second order which again did not turn up !! By now I have had 3 experiences of online purchases which have not turned up. When I asked for some goodwill gesture they offered 50 % off - on purchases online !!! No thank you, never again.

I noticed that I placed an order online and when it reached the time frame for when my order would be delivered (8-12 business days) my order had still not even shipped.When I reached out to customer service their response was-- contact us after 12 days and we will discuss it.A good company would promise expedited shipping and meet their promised date range, not tell their customers to reach back out after their packages are late.  I would not recommend gap for any holiday shopping as they seem to have no interest in backing up their promised delivery date ranges, unless you are Jewish. Seems like if you plan for the first day of Chanukah, you will maybe get it by the last!

Awful. Ive waited 2 weeks for a pair of jeans (still haven't arrived). When I asked why., they sent a link to the courier service so that I could try to fix the problem. Arrogant company. Truly awful online service. Never again !!!!!!!!

Review Title: i missed the sale yesterday because costumer service didnt answer
Review Text: placing order via online was sucks..calling their help line was hard to reach i missed the sale yesterday because they not accepting my card i tried to call their costumer service but no answer  ..

I ordered a parka with Gap and they sent me the wrong size so I returned it on 8/11/16 and tracking says it arrived 10/11/16It's now 17/11/16 and I still haven't been refunded ! They can't find it !!! Customer service is in USA and I'm afraid it's pretty poor I most certainly will not buy from Gap again
I really like the t shirts at the gap

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!! For some reason I was signed up for the cap credit card. When I received the first letter they sent me about it, I called their customer service and they said that my application would be deleted and everything was taken care of. I then received another letter today. THREE WEEKS AFTER they said it was taken care of saying that my credit card was approved. I then had to call @gap again where I was hung up on and transferred SEVERAL times to finally speak to someone that could help me. She was unbelievably rude and unhelpful. She said that my application was redacted and when I asked for my name and details to be removed from the system she proceeded to create an inquiry into this, and said I would receive a letter in twenty days. When I asked why it would take twenty days to just delete my basic information from the system and what the letter would say she was unable to give me any further information. And then threatened me that she would not send my inquiry in. Needless to say I am extremely annoyed, aggravated, and among other things will not be supporting @gap at any of their stores or sister stores. It is a complete outrage to be treated like this when this is @gap mistake. I posted this on Gap's Facebook page and they responded almost a day later that they do not deal with the card accounts and I need to speak to Synergy Bank that is in charge of this. So now I have wasted my time yesterday and do not understand what the woman I spoke to on the phone was doing?

Have loved this store since its launch,always find a bargain as they have sales so often,stylish clothes that wash well time after time,am not someone who likes to wear the same as everyone else,so you will never have that problem if you shop here,have always found the delivery fast and within the time they say.
Dx  delivery  service  are very poor u will not get your order beware

If you can, avoid shopping with Gap online from Austalia. Western Australia doesn't have a Gap store so my only option was ordering goods from the US (even after phoning the Melbourne store but they wouldn't post). The shipping of two pairs of girls shorts cost $42, almost as much as the shorts alone were worth. After a week, I inquired about the shipping advice (given I hadn't received a dispatch confirmation) only to be told that the goods had already been delivered. The problem was that I was in Australia and the goods had been delivered to somewhere in Illinois, US. After corresponding with Gap and asking them to resend the goods but expedite the shipping, given I had lost a week from the original timeline, I was advised post-shipment that the original timeline of the order had been extended and that they may take between 2.5 to 5 weeks to arrive, not counting the week lost from the incorrect delivery. The original advice communicated from Gap in the sales transaction was 2-4 weeks. Gap customer service was at best ambivalent, seemingly wanting to shift responsibility to Borderfree. When paying A$42 for shipping for a package of probably less than 1kg, I expect better service, as I can imagine, would others. Additionally, after further correspondence with Gap's customer service, they stated that if I was unhappy with their online ordering that I could set up a US address and ship there. It's quite stunning really that a company like Gap would offer this as an alternative rather than improving global business and addressing deficiencies in their point to point shipping. Put simply, avoid shopping online at Gap from Australia until they actually start to listen to customers. Until then, they are only paying lip service about customer service and overcharging overseas customers with exorbitant shipping rates.

I bought on-line a number of long-sleeve tops for me here in Australia a couple of weeks ago (Jan 2016)The tops arrived & some were too small. Returning them was a nightmare & in total I am more than $100 out-of-pocket in delivery fees & have nothing to show. I returned them which was complicated but by the time I had the medium were all sold out! What a complete & utter waste of time & money. Won't bother again, will stick to LTS @ least they send out new order post-paid. Shame on you GAP.

Review Title: Bad Customer Service and lack of Intergrity
Review Text: Customers please beware of gap store both in store and online. My unpleasant experience began on Jan 30, 2016 at gap store in Wolfchase mall in memphis TN. I meant with Manager David and Customer Rep Darren, who after a completed transaction so they called it could not give me a confirmed receipt they placed online stating the email would come, even until today Feb 9, 2016 I have not received the so called transaction. They were giving flimsy excuses about wifi this or that... Later come to find out my order was messed up as of today and the prices as they showed me in the store was not the prices the online associates put. As an evidence, My credit card when I called them had a recorded voice of myself and the rep telling the amount of price to approve for the transaction.  My point here is please BEWARE of gap store both online and in store, they are not what they say they are... They perform fraudulent activities on your account if you do not monitor your account on a regular basis and their customer Service is very very very poor. They lack transparency and Intergrity.Customers PLEASE BEWARE!!!! Will NEVER BUY from GAP AGAIN. What a horrible experience. Still shocked from what they performed on my credit card without approval. Thanks to my credit card who caught on very fast.

While I like the clothes from Gap, their shipping policy is totally unreliable.On several occasions, I received notice of a delivery date, only to have it postponed with no explanation. In one instance, after two such delivery "adjustments," my order finally arrived almost three weeks  after the original projected delivery date.  The "helpful" calendar they provide to show when the order will arrive is totally useless when Gap keeps sliding the date.I am now waiting for a package that was originally due to arrive on Feb. 2.  The date was then changed to the 5th. No delivery.  When I last checked, I was informed that the package could not be tracked.  And so it goes....
I had quite a decent experience! I also found the customer care to be a bit unreliable. Would have given 5 stars if I was given better care and service!

Review Title: Email customer service much better than Phone
Review Text: I had an issue that has just been resolved.  When I originally called the customer service on the phone, they said there was nothing I could do about itWhen I emailed shortly after that, they only took a day or two to respond (which was quick since it was during what I'm sure is their busy season), and completely resolved my issue, needing me only to call and confirm a few things Would be 5 stars if I never had to deal with the phone customer service

I visit the Can√≥vanas Outlet in Puerto Rico, very distant of my country only for shop in Gap Outlet. Im shop in Gap for 20 years. It was to my favorite shops. When I choose my merchandise and I go to pay with my Old Navy credit Card, the cashier say that I cant use my credit card because my ID was expired.  My ID have mi SS , my picture and all my personal info. I said her that a few month ago I applied to the Banana Republic card with the same ID and I dont have any problem. She call the manager. I explain the same to him and he was rude. He said is the Company Policy. I said him and alternative option to call the credit card services to confirm my identity and he said that is not possible.  I call to the credit card services and the guy who attended the call explain that yes, is possible the manager call to confirm my identity to use my credit card. He understands that the id is only for identifying proposite. I return to the store and I explain to the manager and he call with bad attitude to the Credit Card Customer Service. When he call, the other guy who attended the call say a diferent policy and he said that he was" worry "that they accept my credit application.  I choose dont shop in Gap anymore. I have a good credit line and I make my payments on time. I was manager in a retail store and I always look the way my clients were satisfied.  Now I understand,  the manager Ego pay her bills.

Review Title: 50% sale should be 50% sale with no exceptions
Review Text: sales were marked 50% for the whole store in the somerset mall except for 2 pants that were not labeled that those were excluded from the sales. There was no sign at all. the poor cashier couldnt do anything against because he cannot decide that. i am very diapointed in the gap company. I my opinion this is dishonest and not really customer friendly.This was the last time i visited a gap store.The competeting store next door had 50 %off everything. There were some things excluded but those were CLEARLY labled. There i found pants for 25$, which is even less than half the price of the gap pants i bought and then returned after i got the other ones.Please rethink your policy and the next sales!!! A disapointed customer

Review Title: Horribly slow shipping and very poor customer service.
Review Text: I placed an order on 11/28 and didn't receive it until 12/22. The order wasn't even processed until 12/7. I called 3 times and all the customer service reps did was blame FedEx for the shipping delays and look online and read me the shipping status. After the second time I called I was told if I didn't receive my order by the following Monday I should call back and they would take action. I called the following Monday when I still hadn't received my order and their "action" was to once again read me the shipping tracking. When I told them to cancel my order and refund my money I was told I'd have to wait to refuse the package and I'll be refunded once they receive it and process the return, which will likely take another month.  I refused the package when it finally arrived and I will never again order from Gap.  I've been a loyal customer for over 25 years but no more!

I ordered a coat as a gift on Black Friday- it is 12/22 and GAP.com still does not know here it is OR if I will receive it by Christmas.  To make matters WORSE they will not honor the price I paid in store as they are "two separate entities"  SO now I have paid GAP $85 dollars a month ago and they are not honoring my purchase. Terrible customer service.
Online shipping is horrible and slow never again.
Nov 29th I ordered something still didn't receive items it's now Dec 09th. Slow shipping

Review Title: Great items and the kids love them
Review Text: Great items, fit well and the kids love them which is always a bonus.

Review Title: Poor customer service, your online delivery people made a mistake and I have to pay for it?
Review Text: My mom had 100 dollars Gap Cash from when she shopped in NY with my sister. In Colorado, we decided to each spend 100 in Gap, she paid for everything and I paid her back. Before going in, I looked at some Gap "featured" outfits and really liked the plaid Henley shirt paired with the flair out pants. We got to the store, but only one plaid Henley shirt was there in XL, not my size. However, I did find the flair out pants. My mom had liked a silk shirt I showed her online, but it also wasn't in store because it was a new style. My mistake, to look online and expect to find it in store. So, we bought the things we could in store, and the cashier ordered the silk shirt and plaid henley, both in medium, through Gap.com. Three weeks later, the package arrives (it took a while), inside was the silk shirt, but instead of the Henley shirt, there is a pair of leggings with a label on it saying it is the plaid Henley. I research online to see which store in Colorado might have the plaid Henley in the right color and size medium. Unfortunately, shirt is sold out online in s, m, and l. The only store that has the right shirt style is in Aurora, 45 minutes away from my house. I put on hold the Medium and Large, the medium was in the wrong color but i was trying it for size, my last resort if the large didn't work being to have my sister in NY get it, which would be complicated because it's an exchange and not just a purchase. Finally, i get to Gap in Aurora and decide the Large is ok. But, because the plastic was labeled as plaid henley and had leggings in it, they said I could not just give them the leggings in exchange for the shirt. The whole process took at least 30 minutes, mostly the employee was getting instructions from a lady on the phone. My review is not against the Gap employees at this store, but rather the lady who was on the phone and Gap.com. Anyways, I didn't just walk out with the plaid Henley (already paid for mind you), I had to pay for the shirt and then now have to ship the leggings to Gap and wait 7 days to be refunded for the shirt. It was so complicated and I have to to all this extra work now. Hopefully I will even be refunded correctly because the receipt from paying today said the tax was 8%, whereas the invoice from online (what was paid before) says 4.25%. What I paid for the plaid Henley was also 50 cents more than the original purchase. So basically, I may be out just a couple dollars, which is ok, but annoying, gas, and time spent. Not much, but it's a lot when it wasn't my mistake and they still make me pay for THEIR mistake. I don't even want this shirt that bad anymore, it didn't fit that nicely because my boobs are too big for it and so the large fit better for that reason, but is wider than would be most flattering. Whatever, I'm ok with that though. Nevertheless, I'm never shopping at Gap or any affiliate stores again because this experience was so annoying and I think their clothes are boring (At Gap).I honestly don't want anything from Gap, like restitution, but they just better refund me correctly. Originally I paid 35.80 for the shirt (cheaper since we used gap cash) but today I paid 37.75 because the shirt cost more and the tax was double. So which will they refund me? The ladies at the store said they'll refund the invoice which is less than what I paid today. Why am I paying for your mistake??

Review Title: Appalling customer service and bad quality control of clothing items
Review Text: I received a pair of jeans through the post which had been obviously poorly manufactured due to the fact that the fit in each leg was completely different: tight in one leg and loose in the other. As a result I called Gap Customer Service and they told me they couldn't exchange items but could refund them and get me the same pair of jeans at the same discounted price that I got them in before, which seemed like a rather arduous and unnecessary process. However, the assistant out in a new order to the same delivery location that I previously had them delivered to, without heeding me or asking any questions. I wanted to get the jeans sent to a work address because unfortunately I do not always have the luxury of being at home. Even after explaining this I was simply told that the order couldn't be cancelled definitively and the assistant would have to put in a cancellation request that doesn't always go through, which would have ended up in me getting 2 pairs of the same jeans. I guess I will have to hope the neighbours are in or else I will have to spend one of my Saturdays travelling off to a collection depot miles outside of London. What joy!

Review Title: Poor attitudes, poor service, poor quality
Review Text: I have been shopping for 25 years at Gap. I have an account in good standing. My children all wore gap clothes growing up.  I purchased Gap apparel because we had a large family and the clothing wore so very well. I shop at both the Keystone Mall Store and at the Edinburg outlet store.     My daughter who also has a Gap account had been in the outlet store and spent over 200.00$.  She had purchased mostly for her children but also bought herself a pair of very soft sweat pants the middle of May. After 4 washing th e fabric had broken down so much you could SEE through it. She purchased then May11 but by July they were literally threadbare. She returned them(10.99) on sake because the fabric was defective!  She had her receipt but was advised they don't accept returns that have been "washed or worn" or past 90 days. So.... Buy wet beware if you receive anything defective and you have washed it or worn it you CANT return it.     The asst. manager was not pleasant or helpful and "we were informed it was corporate policy". I have a feeling that "corporate isn't doing too well". You used to be able to depend on quality clothing- now it pills and in the case if the pants see through after a few washing.      I can only compare them to J.Crew located in both locations that Gap is. The J.Crew staff is exceptionally helpf and nice and they stand behind their merchandise. Also the store is well kept and attractive- not a mixed up mess as the Gap store is.      When customer service and quality sag it's time to shop somewhere else!

Got some pair of jeans and some shits great sale. Line was too long with empty registers they could of made it better. Thas why they dont have 5 stars. But his is my go to store so will keep on going. Lol

We shopped at Gap Valley Fair today (bought over 20 items for the kids) and they ran out of big bags. The cashier (K) gave us multiple small bags and insisted to charge $0.10 / bag.  When we got home, we realized that she double charged us for an item and we reported to the store. The store staff (E) told us to come to the store to review the video which would take about 20 minutes. We requested (E) to make note and perhaps investigate before we show up -- she refused.  This means, I have to leave work, go to the store, wait for them to view the video and give me the $15 refund - ridiculous!   This is unacceptable. Gap should value their customers' time and make effort to address the issue.

Review Title: Hope you dont need help from a supervisor
Review Text: Called to change an address on my order because Gap used an address that I had never shipped too.  I was on the phone over an hour and wanted to talk to a supervisor but was unable to.  UPS or FEDX had not pick up my order yet only a shipping label had been make, but they couldn‚Äôt change the label to the right address.  It don‚Äôt take a lot of "know how" to do this but for some reason they were unable too.  Lol Glad I don‚Äôt work with that group.  So now I have to call the local Post office to change the address on my order which could have been done at Gap.  This is my last order from Gap because if that can‚Äôt change labels that cant get my order right.

Review Title: Love the big sale season and Quality is reliable
Review Text: Quality is reliable, clear labelling in terms of clothing materials. Exchange or refund is painless and yet, salesperson can sense whether or not they can trust the customer before taking goods back or exchange. good price as well Hope it keeps up.

I used to use next, but never again. Gap clothes keep there look longer than other shops. I like there fashionable mens clothes which I don't find at other shops.  Keep up the good work gap Thank you Dan
Love their sale!  Great deals!

I placed 3 seperate orders for Christmas gifts for grandkids on 12-3-14 and 12-4-14. (3 groups of grandkids in US/Abroad) As of today (12-9) 2 of the 3 orders is sitting in "pending" I called CS with Gap and was treated rudely, I actually had to ask her to "stop talking so I could ask a question"  This Grandma will NEVER shop at Gap again!
Cheap clothes, everything is very plain. Customer service is typically friendly

Review Title: Almost 2month wait for a winter coat!!
Review Text: I shopped at Gap online Nov 7th,2014 for a winter coat for my son. At time of purchase est delivery was Nov 23,2014. At the time I figured that was not that bad, however I live in Cleveland, Ohio so snow came early this year so even Nov 23rd was to late. Now I check my order status and it says my son coat is estimated to come Dec 23,2014. That is ridiculous!!! I am so upset. So now I will have to go purchase another coat because we can not wait that long. Very unhappy : (. I did notify Gap but I doubt if there is anything they can do about it.

I stocked up on my winter wear on Friday this week.  Initially started at the GAP store on Regent Street. I was in the Regent Street Store for all of 15 minutes, I had to escape due to the broken speakers blaring out music at the top volume and also staff that were unsure of promotions as well as being unaware of their customers in store. After being let down in Regent Street I decided to go to the bond Street Store and was there for an hour.  Took my time choosing and trying what I needed and the staff were super friendly and efficient from fitting room, shop floor to the till point.  The floor manager (I assume) even stopped a briefing with some of the staff on the floor to ask me what size I could like in a jumper she saw i was looking at and contemplating. Thats service. The service in this store was amazing, not too much, but enough for you to feel valued and looked after if you needed it.  It also has better stock options.   Regent Street: Looks like you need to tips from Bond Street.

Review Title: Clothes Are Reliable but Design Needs Revamp
Review Text: I've grown up wearing gap clothes. Their clothes have been reliable through the years, but their design is a little bit...dare I say it...antiquated. It needs a refresh. Brands like Uniqglo, American Apparel, and Zara have the edge and I'm leaning towards making a purchase from them.

Review Title: Customer service doesn't even try to help, even when it's their fault
Review Text: I'm so frustrated right now.  I made 3 purchases that qualified for "GapCash".  Their system didn't send me the email with the offer code.  I reached out to customer service to find out that the offer expired last week.  The rep didn't offer to help at all.  How is this my error?  I've been a loyal Gap customer for 25+ years.  This is awful!

I ordered 4 items. 2 items were sent in the wrong size. I returned them and was told I could only get a refund and they would not send the correct items. Terrible service ... I will vote with my money and never buy from the Gap again.

I have been shopping on gap.com for my family for years.  Most of our clothing basics come from Gap.  I especially love their waist cinchers for kids clothing.  But the best thing about them is their sales.  Can even get up to 40% off.

I ordered online a pair of. Jeans, size 33 inch waist. I received a pair labelled as 33, but sized a huge 42 inch waist. I returned and received another pair, again labelled 33 but sized 42.I have returned and re ordered five times, all faulty.All my attempts at customer service contact , eight and counting, have resulted in an apology, and a promise of both an investigation and a correct replacement. Gap have repeatedly failed on both counts. Gap are unable to either identify the problem, nor correct it. I suspect gap are too embroiled in beurocracy, poor communication, ineptitude and mis management to be able to provide an acceptable product or service.

I remember first going into a Gap Kids store as a child. The brand still serves a fundamental purpose in my shopping and waredrobe as an adult. They remain a go to for basics and those pieces that you just need as the foundation to your closet. Always seem to have great sales that make for great stocking up trips too!
This is my first time ordering clothes online. It was a great experience, ordered a couple of long sleeve shirts the size was correct and the shipping was ok.
I've just received my two pairs of shoes from Gap. Its all in good condition with best quality. Its seems this online shop is one of the best. I will buy from this shop again.

I like ordering from Gap because their clothes never really goes out of style, and is safe to use for multiple seasons. As a college student, saving money is really important, so I like Gap a lot. They also have great sales a few times during the year so I stock up then. I happily recommend them!

Quality is reliable, clear labelling in terms of clothing materials. Exchange or refund is painless and yet, salesperson can sense whether or not they can trust the customer before taking goods back or exchange. Great skills for that. Hope it keeps up.

Used to be my go to store for causals. But now, quality is going down the slope and the styles are quite boring In addition the sizing is not consistent I have to try out every pant and goes up a size with each washing

Review Title: Over the years GAP increases prices and decreases quality. How disappointing.
Review Text: I have never in my life had a problem with jeans wearing out. That's why I bought from GAP. Yes, their product was moderately expensive, but they fit me fantastically and moreover they LASTED. I would get new jeans more because of growing out of them or significant style changes, but usually I'd wear them for two or three years with no problem whatsoever. In recent years though prices have climbed. What's more, to add insult to injury the quality has plummeted. The company where I used to get jeans for $45 and keep them for three years now charges me $70 for jeans that rip or wear through in a little more than a year. (I am no more active while wearing my jeans than I used to be, if anything I am less so!) Stubbornly I use iron-on patches and rotate the poorer quality pairs into less public/frequent use. Today though is perhaps the final straw. A pair roughly one year old suddenly has a sizable hole on the inner thigh. I feel so betrayed. For over 10 years I give brand loyalty to GAP and this is how I am repaid? By considerably more expensive but far poorer quality products than when I first began shopping with them? If only because I have an unused gift card I will give them one final chance. But after that I plan to find a new brand.
Very good selection at affordable prices. Thumb up!
I love shopping at Gap! easy to find everything, easy checkout process
I really love their fashion! It is very affordable and the quality is good!
Really good product, efficient service.

Review Title: Good value for american style clothes
Review Text: I had a good experience buying with gap. The only thing is that you have to pay for returning the merchandise, when base in continenatal Europe
a little expensive
a little expensive

I feel bad that Gap is having financial troubles. I guess this economy is affecting us all. But I love Gap for their very comfortable clothes at great prices when you find a season-end deal. When you find a deal, Gap often can't be beat!
a little pricey, but good stuff
good stuff...better at sale prices
I order.......and got all deliverd 3 dayes later.I have nothing els to say, that I would buy again without any dought.
I love the huge selection then have on their website. I purchased a couple of jeans from them and they lasted for quite sometime. I highly recommend this website.

Review Title: They say they "can't" and they mean "won't"
Review Text: I tried to return a birthday present I'd bought online about an hour after I bought it, as I realized I'd failed to take advantage of an offer.  They refused to cancel it, said they could not do it, they could only put in a "request" to cancel.  Not only that, but they HAVE NO IDEA when they can tell if if it's canceled or not.   Bull.  They can process an order within minutes, but they can't cancel it within minutes, and in fact "have no idea" if it will be DAYS before they can tell you it's canceled?  And get this:  I wanted to cancel so I could go online and make a LARGER purchase!  Now I can't buy a LARGER birthday present for this person because I don't know if the first one was canceled or not!!!  When they say they "can't," they mean "won't."  They need some serious customer-friendly competition to make them realize what they can or can't do.  I would NEVER use them again.

I purchased some jeans for my daughters for Christmas. AFTER the purchase was completed, there was a note about their "new" return policy.  Seems that returns/exchanges can only be done for 45 days.  Christmas is 60 days away.  Multilple emails to customer "service" were fruitless--as another reviewer said, "arrogant and smarmy" would about cover it.  So I returned the merchandise forthwith. Gap must be doing very well if they're  OK with losing a sale and alienating not one but potentially 3 customers.
